reviews.text:
Free admission. A quiet and peaceful Tibetan Buddhist Centre near Aljunied MRT Station.
I’m not familiar with Tibetan Buddhism, so I won’t comment anything on that. I’ll just share some basic knowledge here.

Buddha 佛: a fully enlightened person
( not a god / deity ).
Amitabha Buddha 阿弥陀佛:
a fully enlightened person named Amitabha, Teacher of Guan Yin Bodhisattva 观音菩萨.

Bodhisattva: an enlightened person
( not a god / deity ).
Commonly known Bodhisattvas are
Guan Yin/ Avalokitesvara （观音菩萨）and Ksitigarbha （地藏菩萨 ）.

Guan Yin is a Bodhisattva, an enlightened person, the Teacher of Compassion. He is not a god / deity and definitely not a goddess. He helps all sentient beings who’s in need.

Ksitigarbha is a Bodhisattva, an enlightened person. He is not a god/ deity. He helps all sentient beings, especially those suffer the most in the hell realm.

Amitabha Buddha Temple is a serene and sacred place filled with peace and positive energy. The tranquil gardens, beautiful statues, and calming atmosphere make it perfect for meditation and reflection. A wonderful spot to find inner peace and spiritual inspiration.
Clean and peaceful venue. Remove footwear before entering the lift to check out their prayer halls
Though not a huge area, the centre seems very organised. Can access to any of the four levels.
Amazing FPMT center, carried out by beautiful and warm hearted people, may all beings benefit from this center
